#Text=Learn More
#Text=About Hubble
#Text=This article talks about how the magnificent
#Text=Hubble space technology has changed astronomers ' views upon our world and worlds beyond it , forever .
#Text=Steps
#Text=Hubble was ' born ' in 1990- as a joint project of NASA and the European Space Agency .
#Text=The telescope orbits Earth 353 miles above the planet 's surface .
#Text=No telescope before Hubble had the high quality resolution to see distant galaxies , home to various different planets and stars .
#Text=There are three stages of Hubble 's sight- the Hubble Deep Field , which was discovered in 1995 , contains 3,000 galaxies in it .
#Text=The second is Hubble Ultra Deep Field , discovered in 2004 , with about 10,000 galaxies and the last one , which contained 30,000 of these wondrous galaxies .
#Text=The deeper Hubble telescope looks into space , the further it gazes back in time .
#Text=Over a period of time , Hubble teamed up with other observatories to examine patches of the sky in high resolution .
#Text=Surveys like like the Hubble Ultra Deep Field have provided pictures of vast , deep collections of galaxies- including some that existed when our universe was less than a billion years old .
#Text=Zooming in , you can see small stars and large planets , moons orbiting planets and stars , and countless galaxies .
#Text=These galaxies merge together to form a single , larger galaxy , and this will be explained later on .
#Text=Scientists have known for a long time that the universe has been expanding , ever since the Big Bang , which was when our galaxy was born .
#Text=Some astronomers believe that if they measure the universes 's size , they can calculate the approximate age of the universe .
#Text=You might be thinking ... how can they measure the distance of the universe ?
#Text=Since you cannot extend a ruler into the stars , they estimate by studying objects ' brightness- for example nearby or distant stars .
#Text=So if the scientists can measure the length of a star , which is part of a galaxy , they can also measure the distance from the Milky Way to that galaxy , too .
#Text=The NGC 4603 galaxy is the most distant galaxy- 108 million light years away .
#Text=It has been found by the same method that scientists use to measure distances between stars- Cepheid variables .
#Text=From Earth , this galaxy 's stars appear very faint .
#Text=Among these magical and intriguing discoveries in outer space , there are also some deathly dangers ...
#Text=Black Holes were originally named ' quasars ' by the first astronomers , and they were thought to be the incredibly bright centers of those faraway galaxies .
#Text=An approximate size of a quasar is the size of our very own solar system- not very big at all in comparison to the universe .
#Text=Luckily , Hubble observations saved the day again , determining that those bright galactic centers are powered by giant black holes .
#Text=They come in various different sizes , but some range form giant black holes in the center of galaxies to small black holes a few times larger than our sun .
#Text=And so we come to the part where we refer back to part 3 where galaxies are said to merge together to form new galaxies .

#Text=Well , Hubble has observed the collision between two galaxies and determined with a lot of evidence , that in the future , our galaxy , the Milky Way , and another close galaxy named Andromeda galaxy will collide in around 4 billion years , when we might not be alive .
#Text=Did you know that Andromeda is the closest galaxy to us ?
#Text=Well , Hubble 's resolution is powerful enough to see its individual stars !
#Text=The stars in the Andromeda have different ages- ranging from six billion years up .
#Text=Scientists believe that this happened because another galaxy has already collided with the Andromeda , making it larger and bigger than before .
#Text=And when the two monster galaxies in the universe collide , there will be an almighty effect .

#Text=But however , some predict that this mighty sight will not cause an effect on Earth and its fellow planets- only the Sun will change its orbit direction and we will become a much larger , wider galaxy .
#Text=Eventually , Hubble telescope 's time will come .
#Text=It will have to ' die ' or ' end its life ' as the telescope we look up to as our eye to the universe .

#Text=But that wo n't be the end- a new telescope , named the James Webb Space Telescope , is Hubble telescope 's successor and will use Infrared vision , instead of Hubble 's usual visible vision to convey the secrets of the universe to us .
#Text=They say infrared is much better than visible light ; you can see fainter objects and the new telescope will be useful for that .
#Text=Webb is made to stand up to -233.3 Celsius- extreme cold weather .
#Text=The James Webb will be the largest telescope ever to orbit our planet .
#Text=The launch for James Webb telescope is scheduled for 2018 , where some lucky people will witness the launch of the James Webb Space telescope , the new eye for our universe .
#Text=Tips
#Text=Get books about the Hubble Space Telescope and read them .
#Text=Also , watch one of the many documentaries about the Hubble .
#Text=Look on NASA 's website for information about Hubble too .
